Title: Advanced Load Building
Description: Advance Load Building is a platform that integrates inbound and outbound shipments from a diverse set of documents into a managing platform able to route and direct loads in a dynamic fashion. Documents such as purchase orders, sales orders, production orders, and transfer orders can be added and removed as needed. Actions such as pickups and drop-offs are created on the fly and results automatically update the original documents as well as inventory status and locations.

NodeName: All / IT - Building and optimizing workspaces in Dynamics, Consuming business events
Title: All / IT - Building and optimizing workspaces in Dynamics, Consuming business events
Description:
Workspaces are personalized work centers with data, reports, and transactions and are designed to increase efficiency of daily tasks. Workspaces can be created and modified by developers. There are many reasons to design and create a workspace in the developer environment rather than the user interface. For instance, your business might want key performance indicator (KPI) tiles, analytical components, drillthrough components, or other advanced features that cannot be created or modified in the user interface.
In this workshop we will:
Design and build key performance indicators (KPIs),Create workspace elements.
Use Report Definition Language (RDL) to create custom reports and Implement reporting components into workspaces.
EmailSubject: All / IT - Building and optimizing workspaces in Dynamics, Consuming business events

NodeName: Analysis of Recall / Replace process using Block chain
Title: Analysis of Recall / Replace process using Block chain
Description: CLEARthru is the first enterprise resource planning (ERP)-based blockchain traceability solution that brings best-in-class supply chain integrity, safety and product source tracking information to consumers. By leveraging blockchain technology, CLEARthru provides access to information across the value chain in seconds.
EmailSubject: Analysis of Recall / Replace process using Block chain

Title: Annual Penetration testing
Description: The objective of penetration testing is to assess the current security controls in an effort to determine the actionable impact form an attacker attempting to bypass perimeter security controls and accessing the internal network or sensitive data.  The focus of penetration testing is not to prove the network is free of all vulnerabilities, but rather to validate the organization's security posture and configuration standards through assessing the resiliency of the external network against a determined attacker. Systems that could be commonly in scope for engagements include application servers, network devices, cloud infrastructure and mail servers.  Any critical findings discovered during the penetration testing will be immediately reported informally to your organization's technical staff and point of contact.  RSM's penetration testing aligns to the Penetration Testing Execution Standard (PTES) and follows the approach that includes foot printing, service and port identification, targeted social engineering, vulnerability identification and exploitation, limited vulnerability scanning, and optional data exfiltration. Internal penetration testing includes the same approach however, it will test the following networks including network infrastructure (including routers, switches and wireless access points), security infrastructure (including firewalls and intrusion detection/prevention systems), domain controls, database servers and web servers.

Title: Business Operations Assessment
Description:
Are all aspects of your business operations contributing to your success? Quickly determine what is working and what is not. We offer business optimization solutions for various aspects of operations, sales, marketing and customer service . 
Ineffective business processes and inefficient departmental workflows raise operating cost and reduce profitability functions.

Title: Business Workflow Design and Optimization
Description: Are you uncertain of the best approach to a particular work process? Do you not have extra time available to design workflows because you are focused on sales efforts and daily business management responsibilities? These are common challenges for executives and our business workflow design and optimization solutions are intended to provide relief. We discuss your objectives and then design an optimized workflow that meets your business needs in the most efficient way.

Title: Catch Weights
Description: The Catch Weight accelerator records weights for items where the weight varies per piece.  Catch Weight provides the ability to sell and process using a physical unit for an item, but price and cost based on actual weight.  Warnings messages are triggered when weights are out of tolerance.

NodeName: cGMP and Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 11 compliance support
Title: cGMP and Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 11 compliance support
Description: RSM has developed last-mile solutions to support life sciences companies during the validation process for 21 CFR Part 11 (electronic signatures), 201, 211 (cGMP) and 820 (quality). Aligning with the FDA's recommendation for a risk-based approach, our solutions balance the adherence to regulations with a change management approach that provides more flexibility to meet changing business requirements.
EmailSubject: cGMP and Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 11 compliance support

Title: cGMP Compliance Assessment
Description: Ensure proper design, monitoring and control of functions in and around manufacturing processes and facilities to meet Current Good Manufacturing Practice (cGMP) requirements. Centrally manage supplier, receiving, quality, material issue, shop floor control, traceability and serialization data, leveraging electronic record-keeping procedures to drive compliance.

NodeName: CIO / IT - Data Integrity, Business logic
Title: CIO / IT - Data Integrity, Business logic
Description: Ability to build business rules that ensure consistent business logic regardless of the app accessing that data set is imperative to a successful business operation. will show you how you can build business rules that are triggered anytime they are used within Common Data Service.
EmailSubject: CIO / IT - Data Integrity, Business logic

NodeName: CIO/ CISO / IT - Security roles and privelages
Title: CIO/ CISO / IT - Security roles and privelages
Description:
Finance and Operations apps use role-based security to assign access to components in the system. A user who is assigned to a security role has access to the set of privileges that is associated with that role.
In this workshop we will:
Create and modify roles, duties, privileges, and permissions, Review the role-based security hierarchy, Use and enforce permissions policies, Define the extensible data security framework (XDS) and apply security permissions.
EmailSubject: CIO/ CISO / IT - Security roles and privelages

Title: Client Experience
Description: Assessment of channel strategy execution,  customer profitability, pricing strategy, voice of the customer and customer journey mapping.

Title: Cloud Spend Management
Description:
Mange environments, to be up when they need to be, down when they should so that clients do not unknowingly rakc up expenses. 
We will also cloud budget to actual on a rolling monthly basis.

Title: Commodity Contract Management
Description: CCM for Growers, Packers, and Shippers extends D365FO to effectively manage contractual relationships with vendors. CCM for the grower industry eases the management of contracts, adjustments, product receptions and vendor AP settlement processes. The accelerator accommodates AP transactions and inventory updates to avoid redundant data entry tasks. Features such as advance payment management, material issuance and finished goods recovery, third party vendor payment, and grower discounts are some of the main features.  CCM for the Dairy industry facilitates document and manages contractual relationships with processors. From contract creation to automatic AP invoice generation, and from quality controlled product reception to inventory update and tank management, this accelerator leverages base infrastructure such as product formulas and batch attributes to calculate producer payments based on component potencies. Adjustment and advance management are added to support financial processes related to price changing strategies and payment advance and deductions.

NodeName: Common Data Service - Analytics and Monitoring (Monitoring for integrations)
Title: Common Data Service - Analytics and Monitoring (Monitoring for integrations)
Description: Identify your most active users, the number and types of operations they're performing, number of pages requests, most-used entities, workflows, plug-ins, and more, over a period of time as you work toward your adoption goals. Monitor storage quotas, storage use, and top tables by size to optimize performance.
EmailSubject: Common Data Service - Analytics and Monitoring (Monitoring for integrations)

Title: Customer Insights
Description:
Dynamics 365 Customer Insights helps you build a deeper understanding of your customers. Connect data from various transactional, behavioral, and observational sources to create a 360-degree customer view. Use these insights to drive customer-centric experiences and processes.

Customer Insights enables every organization to unify and understand their customer data and to harness it for intelligent insights and actions.Customer Insights enables every organization to unify and understand their customer data to harness it for intelligent insights and actions.

With Customer Insights, organizations can:

Eliminate data silos and unify customer data

Connect and unify your data with ease-bring in transactional, observational, and behavioral data from popular data sources by using prebuilt connectors.
Transform customer data intelligently-build unified customer profiles conforming to the Common Data Model. Resolve customer identities with AI/ML-driven recommendations.
Enrich with audience intelligence contained within Microsoft Graph

Build richer customer profiles by incorporating audience intelligence contained within Microsoft Graph.
Power your business processes and personalized customer experiences

Drive personalized engagement across channels-empower marketing, sales, and service professionals with out-of-the-box, contextual customer insights and tailored customer profile cards infused into the business applications they already use every day
Automate customer-centric experiences and processes based on customizable profiles, business measures, and segments.
Enable and extend line-of-business experiences built on the Microsoft Power Platform. Quickly build custom business applications with embedded customer insights using a powerful click-and-point approach from PowerApps.

Title: Data Loss Prevention Assessment
Description:
One day DLP Workshop - interactive sessions that consist of education of Microsoft DLP concepts and solution offerings through discussion of use cases, scenarios and product demonstrations from the RSM demo environment
 Department Data Sensitivity Meetings - RSM will lead meetings with Client department information owners to both educate them on upcoming capabilities of the DLP implementation and document the sensitive data identified by the groups.
 DLP Planning, Service Enablement and Documentation - We will work with client IT resources to provision and set up perquisite services and setting to facilitate the DLP solution.
To identify scope we would need to perform a scoping session to identify the number of business processes in scope, 2-4 hours.

Title: Data Quality Assessment
Description:
Establish whether the current application data and
administrative data management procedures are meeting the
goals of the product-and provide recommendations to
eliminate existing issues such as duplication and low integrity.

Title: Desktop Management
Description: RSM device management professionals address the most prevalent device management questions for IT directors and managers who are seeking a better level of control over their end-user devices. Questions such as: How do we secure our devices but still leave flexibility--so our end users don't feel that we're applying too much control? How can we stay in compliance with regulatory issues without sacrificing access to data? How do we embrace increased mobility with distributed teams, including potential issues with Shadow IT and BYOD? How do we let our employees use the devices they need, while lowering costs, and quickly adjust to change as it occurs?

Title: Direct Store Delivery
Description: An app for Direct Store Delivery (DSD) solution for Distribution and CPG companies which automates and digitize the entire delivery operations of field sales including van sales and direct store delivery

Title: Dynamics Performance Monitoring
Description:
Monitors, correlates and investigates alerts to detect and resolve incidents proactively. Review and take action on telemetry data capturing - Monitoring, Diagnostics and Analytics. Availability monitoring - This type of monitoring performs a check against the environment to make sure that it's available at all times. If the check fails, the Microsoft Service Engineering team is immediately notified.
Health monitoring - In addition to availability checks, some basic health checks must be performed. These health checks span various components, such as Application Object Server (AOS), Batch Framework, Data Management Framework, Microsoft Azure SQL, and Management Reporter. These checks are done based on multiple data sources, such as the telemetry that is collected from the environments, checks that are done by a watchdog service that continuously monitors the environment, and CPU counters and other system-level counters that the environment emits

Title: Dynamics Performance Monitoring
Description:
Monitors, correlates and investigates alerts to detect and resolve incidents proactively. Review and take action on telemetry data capturing - Monitoring, Diagnostics and Analytics. Availability monitoring - This type of monitoring performs a check against the environment to make sure that it's available at all times. If the check fails, the Microsoft Service Engineering team is immediately notified.
Health monitoring - In addition to availability checks, some basic health checks must be performed. These health checks span various components, such as Application Object Server (AOS), Batch Framework, Data Management Framework, Microsoft Azure SQL, and Management Reporter. These checks are done based on multiple data sources, such as the telemetry that is collected from the environments, checks that are done by a watchdog service that continuously monitors the environment, and CPU counters and other system-level counters that the environment emits

Title: E-Learning - L&D
Description: Tailored Dynamics365 and Power Platform training content to keep your users updated in the Digital transformation journey

Title: Finance - AP Automation
Description: Organizations that want to streamline their Accounts payable (AP) processes often identify invoice processing as one of the top process areas that should be more efficient. In many cases, these organizations offload the processing of paper invoices to a third-party optical character recognition (OCR) service provider. They then receive machine-readable invoice metadata together with a scanned image of each invoice. RSM advisors can help automate AP processes and acheive the efficincies. These transactions can also be received as EDI transactions.

Title: Finance - AR - Predicting Late Payments
Description:
Effectively managing receivables is important to the overall financial health of a business. The Late Payment Prediction extension can help you reduce outstanding receivables by predicting whether sales invoices will be paid on time. During this workshop we will workshop the machine learning tool on your test enviornment and check for the best setup. You can analyze all sales invoices in the Customer Ledger Entries window, where you can also dig deeper into each posted invoice. The Late Payment field shows the outcome of the prediction.
You can predict late payments up-front. In the Sales Quotes, Sales Orders, and Sales Invoices windows you can use the Predict Payment action to generate a prediction for the sales document you're viewing.

Title: Finance - Bank Automation
Description:
Organization with the following needs can benefit from bank automation - Cash & bank management, fully unattended bank reconciliation, automated bank communications
vendor payment automation, customer payment automation, credit card processing in app and portal, Integration to any bank, multi-company, multi-country banking transactions, advanced payment application, foreign exchange settlements, risk management and enhanced communication security

NodeName: Finance - Cash, bank management and sales tax
Title: Finance - Cash, bank management and sales tax
Description: Cash and bank management in Dynamics 365 Finance gives the capabilities to maintain an organization's bank accounts and the financial instruments that are associated with those bank accounts. All businesses must collect and pay taxes to various tax authorities. In this workshop you will cover the capabilities of the product and how it applies to your business.
EmailSubject: Finance - Cash, bank management and sales tax

Title: Finance - Commodity pricing in Dynamics365
Description:
The fall and rise of prices for commodities such as renewable energy, natural gas, coal, and oil in manufacturing affect the cost of production. In this module, you will learn how to set up commodity pricing and stay in compliance for your finished goods.
In this workshop we will cover - 
commodity pricing in Supply Chain Management and product compliance in Supply Chain Management.

NodeName: Finance - Credit, Collections and Credit Card Reconciliation
Title: Finance - Credit, Collections and Credit Card Reconciliation
Description:
Although most customers pay their invoices on time, you must be able to process invoices that are not paid by their due date. Accounts receivable collections information is managed in one central view by using the Collections page in Dynamics 365 Finance. Credit and collections managers can use this central view to manage collections.In this workshop we will cover - 
credit and collections components, configure aging reports, customer pools, collection agents, aging period definitions, manage interest and collection letters. We will also cover reconciliation process of bank statements and credit card transactions.
EmailSubject: Finance - Credit, Collections and Credit Card Reconciliation

Title: Finance - Fixed Assets in Dynamics365
Description:
Set up and enter acquisition information for fixed assets, and then manage them by depreciating them and setting a capitalization threshold to determine depreciation. Additionally, calculate adjustments to the fixed assets and dispose of them. Using general ledger together with fixed assets to view the current value of all fixed assets.
In this workshop , we will: perform fixed asset acquisition, perform fixed asset depreciation and perform fixed asset disposal.

Title: Finance - Project Accounting
Description: Plan, create, manage, control, and complete projects for your organization including time and materials, fixed price, and internal projects like investment, cost, and time projects. You can create a project hierarchy comprising multiple subprojects in Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Operations. Easily plan projects, large or small, by matching work requirements with available resources. Work breakdown structure templates make it easy to quickly plan common types of projects. Task requirements (skills, education, experience) help find the right resource for the job. Track Budget to Actuals, Utilization in the Project workspace.

Title: Finance, Operations - Vendor Portal
Description:
Speed, accuracy, and a digital solution when communicating with vendors is an essential need for a successful business. Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management offers seamless collaborations with vendors through the Vendor collaboration portal. In this workshop we will - 
Configure vendor collaborations, work with the Vendor collaboration workspace, use vendor collaboration as part of a procure-to-pay process.

Title: Freshness Rules
Description: Freshness rules allows an organization to restrict the availability of an Item Lot Number to ship to a Customer based on the Customers shelf-life requirements. Further, the Freshness rules provide the flexibility to ship items that may violate the shelf-life rules by providing users warning messages during the picking and shipping process.

Title: HIPAA Remediation Assistance
Description: RSM can provide technical and procedural remediation activities to help our clients achieve and maintain HIPAA Compliance.

Title: Implementation Assessment - POR
Description:
Dynamics 365 F&O HealthCheck service helps your
organization identify any factors limiting the success of your
system. Our analysis assesses the issues specific to your
organization's deployment of Dynamics 365 and identifies the
opportunities available to realize the desired benefits from the
system.

Title: Industry 4.0
Description: Readiness assessment for Industry 4.0, followed by recommendations and strategy to prepare you for the upcoming shifts in the industry

Title: Industry Essentials for Food
Description:
Industry essentials is a collection of minor enhancements to the standard product that doesn't meet the needs of our Consumer Products Industry.  The solution set includes:

Interactive unit of measure conversions
Pallet estimates
Member sets
Automatic backorder cancellation (fill and cancel)
Purchase order purge
Over-receive tolerances and priorities
Sales order release minimums
Bill of ladings
Item labels
Bill of material and routing by location
Copy comments
Auto-create warehouse shipments
Enable customer catalog?

Title: Infrastructure - Security and Compliance
Description:
In today's always-on business world, you can count on RSM for the advice and security architecture design skills that safeguard your network, data and client files. Good advice and a solid design provide true value only when implemented correctly. RSM also brings the high-level technical skills required to implement and maintain the security and compliance technology you choose.
Be better prepared for the challenges of a potential data breach or weather disaster. Stay agile to manage evolving regulatory standards. Align data with workflows and adapt to changing data protection and network access rules, even as you integrate cloud-based work tools.

RSM's industry expertise, combined with in-depth technological skill sets, helps keep your organization operating smoothly and safely. Define and refine security strategies as threats change, creating an environment that not only benefits your organization, but increases the value you bring to partners, suppliers and clients.

Title: Innovation Challenge
Description:
Digital transformation is a business innovation fueled by the explosion of the cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT). and allows organizations with new ways to understand and transform their business.
. This optimization service will focus on client teams to generate uses cases for innovation in Automation (RPA), IOT, AI / ML, Mobile App, Cloud adoption

Title: IOT - Getting started with IOT
Description: Internet of Things (IoT) is one of the go-to solutions for executives looking for more and better insights about their business. Collectively, IoT is made up of a network of devices and sensors, otherwise known as things, which connect to a company's network and the cloud by various means. These devices generate data about the organization and its operations, and stream it to data stores and apps where it can be analyzed and acted upon. The resulting insights enable organizations to take action in response to something that has already happened, or which is expected to. Based on the innnovation challenge for IOT, workshop to build out IOT workloads

NodeName: IT - Common Data Services and Power platform
Title: IT - Common Data Services and Power platform
Description: The Power Platform services like Power Apps and Power Automate are tools outside of the developer environment that you can use to create efficient ways to get more work done with Finance and Operations apps.
EmailSubject: IT - Common Data Services and Power platform

NodeName: IT - Optimizing your user interface in Dynamics365
Title: IT - Optimizing your user interface in Dynamics365
Description: Enhance user satisfaction by improving usability,accessibility and improve overall efficiency of the solution. We streamline desin and optimize the user interface for maximum productivity. We cover visual UI. Preferences (defaults), Accounts, workflows, Fasttabs, Factboxes, Related information, Action panes, Quick filters, navigation pane, short cut menus, adding apps, importing, exporting, adding a tile, list or link to a workspace, adding summary from a workspace to a dashboard etc.
EmailSubject: IT - Optimizing your user interface in Dynamics365

Title: IT Maturity Assessment
Description: RSM's IT Maturity Assessment rates the health of your technology operations, strategy, security and staffing. Gain a holistic view of the maturity of your IT environment, and see how you rank within your industry.

Title: IT Maturity Assessment
Description: RSM's IT Maturity Assessment rates the health of your technology operations, strategy, security and staffing. Gain a holistic view of the maturity of your IT environment, and see how you rank within your industry.

NodeName: IT, Operations - Reporting - Inventory, Manufacturing, Warehouse etc
Title: IT, Operations - Reporting - Inventory, Manufacturing, Warehouse etc
Description:
One of the factors for a successful business is having visibility into how much inventory exists at any given time. Inventory reports in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management will show how much inventory you have in variety of different ways, and will explain how to be more effective in your inventory investments.

In this workshop, we will cover:
ABC classification, Using the Physical inventory by inventory dimension report, using the Inventory value reports and using the Inventory on-hand mobile workspace.
EmailSubject: IT, Operations - Reporting - Inventory, Manufacturing, Warehouse etc

Title: Lean Manufacturing in Dynamics365
Description: Lean manufacturing is a journey of continuous improvement. The goal is to produce exactly what the customer wants, when the customer wants it, and in an economical manner. For lean manufacturing, perfection is an aspiration. You can use lean manufacturing in a unified (mixed-mode) manufacturing environment that combines various supply, production, and sourcing strategies. These strategies include production orders, batch orders for process industries, purchase orders, and transfer orders. The lean manufacturing architecture in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management consists of production flows, activities, and Kanban rules.

Title: License and Storage cost management
Description: Periodic checks to validate if a client is paying for unneeded licenses and Managing storage effectively to minimize cost

Title: Life Science Essentials
Description: The Life Science Essentials accelerator enforces the strict requirements imposed by regulatory bodies. Actions performed through the system are captured and restricted to a higher degree of granularity and through a streamlined interface to utilize the base D365 e-signature usage. Such actions are logged and stored for future auditing should the need arises. The accelerator also features integration to Cardinal Health, a 3rd party logistics partner for many clients. The Cardinal Health Integration is a report to file integration allowing D365 to consume transactional reporting from an external inventory management system.  An integration workbench exists in D365 as a frontend interface for client users to manage the physical and financial transactions imported and processed by D365.

Title: Managed Device
Description: All-inclusive approach including M365 licensing and user and device support

Title: Managed M365
Description: Monthly per user subscription service designed to maximize the value of your Office 365 investment by bundling licensing with learning resources, access to experts, and other premium capabilities.

Title: Managed Network Services
Description: RSM handles monitoring, patching, support, and projects related to routing, switching, firewall, and wireless.

NodeName: Manufacturing - activity-based subcontracting and production flow costing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
Title: Manufacturing - activity-based subcontracting and production flow costing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
Description: Subcontracting functionality in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management offers visibility of the components that are provided to the subcontractor and also, if necessary, capacity visibility at the subcontractor. Additionally, working with kanban planning and process boards allows companies to make quick, informed decisions to effectively manage demand variations, especially when they are analyzing the production flow costing in lean manufacturing.
EmailSubject: Manufacturing - activity-based subcontracting and production flow costing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

Title: Microsoft Relationship Sales (MRS)
Description:
The Microsoft Relationship Sales solution brings together LinkedIn Sales Navigator and Dynamics 365 Sales to empower sellers to drive more personalized and meaningful engagements with buyers. InMails by LinkedIn are a commonly used communication channel for sales representatives to connect with their customers. Dynamics 365 Sales will foster efficient customer engagement by allowing sales reps to compose and send InMail from within Dynamics 365 Sales entities.

To help sellers more easily identify contacts, profile pictures from LinkedIn will now be available within Dynamics 365 Sales.

Title: Networking and Data Center
Description:
Managing technology demands is a balancing act involving people, devices, networks, data flows and security. Simplifying access for one group will impact another. Newer doesn't always mean better, without regular monitoring to ensure peak performance. RSM sees the bigger strategy vision and handles the smallest operating details.

Definitions of "user" range widely from employees to clients to outside partners, and your organization needs systems for the needs of each audience. In the dynamic middle market, RSM can provision everything from networking systems to omni-channel call centers to data center strategies and web applications. Our diverse experience means you can confidently equip your teams with integrated telecom and cloud-based Unified Communications systems. Connect these data sets to uncover new details about your organization.

RSM helps you balance a technology foundation that brings the right mix of integration and security, compliance and resilience, operating costs and time savings. We support it all -- from call center to data center. Managed services or advisory planning, across a wide spectrum of industries and vendors worldwide. Data strategies and data center performance are critical to organizational knowledge and health. Count on RSM to help you get maximum value from your technology and data.

NodeName: Operations - Capacity planning and scheduling in Dynamics365
Title: Operations - Capacity planning and scheduling in Dynamics365
Description: The role of the scheduling system in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management is to plan the production process so that each operation in the production route is assigned a starting and ending date and time, and that the materials needed for production are available when the operation starts.In this workshop, we will learn cover: Working with capacity planning, scheduling a production order, spliting a production order, setting up scrap and waste.
EmailSubject: Operations - Capacity planning and scheduling in Dynamics365

Title: Operations - Demand Forecasting
Description:
Demand forecasting is used to predict independent demand from sales orders and dependent demand at any decoupling point for customer orders. The enhanced demand forecast reduction rules provide an ideal solution for mass customization.

To generate the baseline forecast, a summary of historical transactions is passed to Microsoft Azure Machine Learning hosted on Azure. Because this service isn't shared among users, it can easily be customized to meet industry-specific requirements. You can use Supply Chain Management to visualize the forecast, adjust the forecast, and view key performance indicators (KPIs) about forecast accuracy.

Title: Operations - Production Control - Process
Description:
The life cycle of production begins with the creation of the production order, batch order, or kanban. It ends with a finished, manufactured item that is ready for either a customer or another phase of production. Each step in the life cycle requires different kinds of information to complete the process. As each step is completed, the production order, batch order, or kanban shows a change in the production status. Different types of products require different manufacturing processes.
In this workshop we will cover - 
Discrete, lean, and process manufacturing methodologies, Unified manufacturing ,configure production control for unified manufacturing capacity planning, Integration between the General ledger and the Production control modules, Production pools
and working with allocation keys

Title: Operations - Quality Control
Description:
An important factor that impacts a company's reputation in today's market is the quality of their goods and services. By having a standard procedure for checking the quality of products when they arrive from vendors, move through supply chain, and are sent to customers, companies can reduce the number of returns and maintain their reputation in the market.
In this workshop we will cover -
Features of Dynamics quality management, perform quality control processes, apply inventory blocking and perform quarantine management.

Title: Operations - Transportation Management
Description: Transportation management in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management helps you find the most efficient way to deliver goods to your customers. Transportation management calculates the least expensive and fastest way of delivering goods and lets you identify vendor and routing solutions for inbound and outbound orders.

Title: Operations - Warehouse Management for Manufacturers
Description:
Do you want to get the best out of warehouse management to support your manufacturing activities? In this workshopwe will cover the manufacturing-specific warehouse management features in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management such as - production input and output locations, staging and order picking, releasing BOM and formula lines to the warehouse,
cross-docking and visibility into material exceptions.

Title: Operations Strategy Assessment
Description: Supply Chain and Channel distribution strategy, SKU Rationalization, Operating model definition and transformation

Title: Operations, Finance - Asset Management
Description: Asset Management for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management will enable customers to optimize maintenance processes and help with maintenance planning, execution, and analytics. The functionality will help to reduce downtime and overall maintenance cost. Asset Management is an advanced module for managing assets and maintenance jobs in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Asset Management integrates seamlessly with several modules in Finance and Operations apps.

Title: Operations, Finance - MRP in Dynamics365
Description:
Businesses in any market, such as retail, manufacturing, distribution, services, and public sector organizations, need functionality to help them plan for demand and supply of products and services during the course of short or long-term operations. Get to know the Master planning feature of Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to streamline your planning, based on pre-determined factors, to efficiently plan what materials need to be purchased, transferred, or manufactured.
In this workshop we will cover -
- Features of master planning in Dynamics365, demand and supply forecasts, calculated delays, intercompany master planning and running plans and firm planned orders.

NodeName: Operations, Finance, IT - Automating business process flows
Title: Operations, Finance, IT - Automating business process flows
Description: Common techniques in regard to automating business process flows, along with explaining the context of when these scenarios might be applied. Any organization that uses labor on a large scale for general knowledge process work, where people are performing high-volume, highly transactional functions, can boost their capabilities and save money and time with automation.
EmailSubject: Operations, Finance, IT - Automating business process flows

Title: Organizational Change Management
Description:
There are four main aspects of change associated with most projects; strategy (context), technology, process, and
people. Technology can be quantified and processes can be measured. Measuring the contribution of Organizational
Change Management (OCM) has been tricky and difficult. The challenge is; change involves people, and when you are dealing with people you are managing emotions, uncertainties and inconsistencies. Experts at can RSM helps you navigate through this change.

Title: Performance Improvement
Description: Business turnaround, Cost management and cost take out, working capital improvement, service level transformation, quality improvement

Title: Pharmaceutical Contract Management
Description: The Life Sciences industry has very complex pricing requirements.   RSM's Pharmaceutical Contract Management solution helps clients manage these complicated sales contracts and pricing agreements with their distributors, wholesalers, and end customers.   Item accruals are calculated at the time of sale in order to meet manufacturer's accounting requirements.  Sales price maintenance can be managed in Excel and uploaded back to D365.  The chargeback workbench automatically processes and validates large volumes of chargebacks taken as deductions by wholesalers.

Title: Provisioning
Description: This service allows you scale up IT infrastructure on demand. Managed Services enables you to quickly and easily deploy your cloud infrastructure, and simplifies the on-demand provisioning of commonly used pre-defined cloud stacks. With an infrastructure designed to meet your application needs, Azure Managed Services' automation and integration with your existing ITSM service catalog allows you to quickly stand up applications in either test or production environments through a self-service portal.

Title: Quarterly CTO Review
Description: Based on Indsutry trend, customer vision provide vision of what the client need to do in the platform going forward. Also includes platform usage  i.e. if the client is using services they already subscribe.

Title: R&D Tax Credits
Description: Find out if you have been gettnig the tax credits for your R&D acitivities. The federal government recognizes that innovation has always been a driving force in the American economy. Through the Research and Development (R&D) Tax Credit (which has expired and been extended 15 times to date) companies can realize a net benefit based on a percent of qualified annual research expenditures that exceed a base amount. In addition to the federal credit, many states offer local R&D tax credits, with parameters that closely mirror the federal program. Despite these opportunities, many companies fail to realize the full benefit of R&D credits because they either don't understand the full range of activities and expenses that qualify or don't develop adequate supporting documentation to sustain the credits under IRS or state examinations.

Title: Release Management
Description: Validate the upcoming features and capabilities months in advance before they're enabled automatically twice per year, during the April and October updates. Early access allows you to try and validate these new features in a non-production environment and get ready to roll out the changes with confidence to users.

Title: RSAT
Description:
The Regression suite automation tool (RSAT) significantly reduces the time and cost of user acceptance testing (UAT). UAT is typically required before you take a Microsoft application update, or before you apply custom code and configurations to your production environment. RSAT lets functional power users record business tasks by using Task recorder and then convert the recordings into a suite of automated tests, without having to write source code.

RSAT is fully integrated with Microsoft Azure DevOps for test execution, reporting, and investigation. Test parameters are decoupled from test steps and stored in Microsoft Excel files.

Title: Sales / Marketing / Operations - Ecommerce
Description: Elevate your brand with Dynamics 365 Commerce. Deliver personalized, seamless shopping experiences across physical and digital channels.

Title: Sales Insights
Description:
Dynamics 365 Sales Insights continuously analyzes the vast collection of customer-interaction data already stored in your Dynamics 365 Sales and Office 365 databases. This helps you to better understand your business relationships, evaluate your activities in relation to previous successes, and choose the best path forward. Also, it enables you to build strong relationships with customers, take actions based on insights, and close opportunities faster.

Sales Insights helps organizations in the following four areas:

Guided selling: Guide sellers on their next course of action with timely and actionable insights.
Productivity intelligence: Free up sellers' time by minimizing manual data entry with contextual, real-time suggestions for updating existing records and creating new records, making sure your data is always up to date.
Connection insights: Build stronger relationships with customers and move relationships forward with AI-guided selling. Take preemptive steps to mitigate risks with a relationship health score.
Predictive models: Increase conversion and win rates by using AI to prioritize leads and opportunities with the highest likelihood to convert and buy.

NodeName: Security and Compliance (Access and Identity Mapping & Data Protection analysis)
Title: Security and Compliance (Access and Identity Mapping & Data Protection analysis)
Description:
Advice, Design and Implementation - RSM experts can help you create, test and implement pro-active measures that enhance efficiency and simplify regulatory compliance. For example, when people change jobs or tasks, identity management tools and processes help ensure IT system and data access controls are updated accordingly. Make your operations more resilient by coordinating people, process and tools.

Turn to RSM for:
Access and Identity Mapping 
How is your critical organizational data being used? Who can view, delete or save sensitive files? By building rules and workflows, you can more easily manage employee profiles or temporary rights in active directories, cloud applications or group roles. Assign, track and report on data access and file transfers to improve knowledge about your organization.

Data Protection 
Analyze storage, back-up, replication and restoration with up-to-date safety standards that maximize your IT budget while streamlining workloads. Companies turn to RSM for ongoing support, and even turnkey management, for ever-growing data storage and security complexity.

Security That Fits Your Needs 
Experienced consultants know your industry and help craft the appropriate solution for specific state and federal requirements, meeting compliance goals while ensuring network protection. Count on RSM's hundreds of consultants to not only keep you aware of the newest threats and responses, but to also keep your systems up to date with the latest patches, the most current version releases, and implementation of new best practice solutions and processes.
EmailSubject: Security and Compliance (Access and Identity Mapping & Data Protection analysis)

Title: Storage and Recovery
Description:
Data management "right-sized" for your growing business
Robust data management capabilities coupled with solid storage architecture allow your business to take advantage of new technologies like server and desktop virtualization-technologies that increase security, asset utilization, performance and availability.

Our years of experience designing and implementing storage and recovery systems have proven the value of viewing your needs holistically to gain an understanding of your data growth, retention and compliance requirements and business continuity objectives.

To help ensure you receive the optimal service experience, we've met rigorous certification requirements and established strategic partnerships with industry leaders like Microsoft, Dell, HP, NetApp, Symantec, Veeam and Autonomy.

RSM Storage and Recovery Infrastructure Solutions

Rapid Assessment and health-checks
Storage architecture design and planning
Storage area networks (SAN) and storage virtualization
Data protection and backup
Disaster recovery and replication

Title: Supply Chain Planning
Description: Delivered from the lense of management consulting advisors in collaboration with Dynamics advisors - Sales and operation planning, costing and profitability, demand planning and forecasting, production planning and inventory management.

Title: System Job Cleanup
Description: System jobs are created with many different operations within the system. As these system jobs are often recurring, in some cases as often as hourly, the records of these operations can quickly become a large drag on the system if they are not properly maintained. We can help review the existing records for cleanup to ensure system performance. Additionally, we will create new cleanup jobs to perform ongoing maintenance on the system jobs.

Title: System Usability Assessment
Description:
Designed to identify whether gaps exist in your intended
application usage and adoption, and to provide
recommendations for corrective action that you can take to
expand the adoption of the application

Title: Upgrade Assessment
Description: AX to F&O - If you are thinking about upgrading your legacy on premise version of Dynamics to Dynamics 365 our experienced team can assist. We will determine the requirements of your project and what upgrade methodology best fits your business needs.

Title: User Audit
Description: Check if the client is using the right user license for the role

Title: Validation services for FDA and Global Regulatory Agencies
Description: RSM has developed last-mile solutions to support life sciences companies during the validation process for 21 CFR Part 11 (electronic signatures), 201, 211 (cGMP) and 820 (quality). Aligning with the FDA's recommendation for a risk-based approach, our solutions balance the adherence to regulations with a change management approach that provides more flexibility to meet changing business requirements.
EmailSubject: Validation services for FDA and Global Regulatory Agencies

Title: Vulnerability assessments
Description: The objective of a vulnerability assessment is to identify critical system-based vulnerabilities exposed on your external assets by conducting an automated vulnerability scan and follow-up analysis. Vulnerability assessments are generally considered best practice and are documented as a minimum baseline within many information security frameworks, such as National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard (DSS). Conducting quarterly vulnerability scans is a fundamental step in the overall vulnerability management process.  Scanning can include some of the following systems but is not limited to servers, work stations, network servers, files transfer protocol (FTP) servers, VPN concentrators and mail servers.  Activities to be performed include service and port identification, vulnerability scanning, advanced testing and reporting.

Title: Work Process Documentation
Description: Are your work processes documented? If not, as your business grows, inconsistencies and slow responsiveness may result in lower customer satisfaction. Employees may also become frustrated by loosely defined task and lack of clarity resulting in high turnover rates and poor performance.

Title: Workflows in Dynamics365
Description: Some organizations require that specific processes are approved by a user other than the person who enters the record. These workflow processes might require manual approval, workflow approval, or no approval. In this workshop: use the workflow architecture, elements, and actions, create and set up workflows, configure workflow properties, configure a manual task in a workflow, configure an automated task in a workflow, configure an approval process in a workflow, assign users to workflow elements, configure an approval step in a workflow, use work items functionality.

Title: Compliance - Infrastructure
Description: Step-by-step process for extending your security and identity perimeter in the cloud, while providing features which help you meet various compliance program requirements (HIPAA, HITRUST, GDPR, SOC, NIST, ISO, PCI, FedRAMP). This process includes the critical tasks of Active Directory integration, security onboarding and customer control mapping. Our rigor and controls help to enforce your corporate and security infrastructure policies, and enable you to develop solutions and applications using your preferred development approach.

Title: Data Quality Assessment
Description:
Establish whether the current application data and
administrative data management procedures are meeting the
goals of the product-and provide recommendations to
eliminate existing issues such as duplication and low integrity.

Title: Vulnerability assessments
Description: The objective of a vulnerability assessment is to identify critical system-based vulnerabilities exposed on your external assets by conducting an automated vulnerability scan and follow-up analysis. Vulnerability assessments are generally considered best practice and are documented as a minimum baseline within many information security frameworks, such as National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and Payment Card Industry (PCI) Data Security Standard (DSS). Conducting quarterly vulnerability scans is a fundamental step in the overall vulnerability management process.  Scanning can include some of the following systems but is not limited to servers, work stations, network servers, files transfer protocol (FTP) servers, VPN concentrators and mail servers.  Activities to be performed include service and port identification, vulnerability scanning, advanced testing and reporting.

Title: Annual Penetration testing
Description: The objective of penetration testing is to assess the current security controls in an effort to determine the actionable impact form an attacker attempting to bypass perimeter security controls and accessing the internal network or sensitive data.  The focus of penetration testing is not to prove the network is free of all vulnerabilities, but rather to validate the organization's security posture and configuration standards through assessing the resiliency of the external network against a determined attacker. Systems that could be commonly in scope for engagements include application servers, network devices, cloud infrastructure and mail servers.  Any critical findings discovered during the penetration testing will be immediately reported informally to your organization's technical staff and point of contact.  RSM's penetration testing aligns to the Penetration Testing Execution Standard (PTES) and follows the approach that includes foot printing, service and port identification, targeted social engineering, vulnerability identification and exploitation, limited vulnerability scanning, and optional data exfiltration. Internal penetration testing includes the same approach however, it will test the following networks including network infrastructure (including routers, switches and wireless access points), security infrastructure (including firewalls and intrusion detection/prevention systems), domain controls, database servers and web servers.

Title: Wireless testing
Description:
Most organizations are using some sort of wireless technology to support their employees or customers which makes it an increasingly prominent target for cyberattacks. Wireless networks provide convenience and mobility, but bring their own risks that are often overlooked as organizations test and secure their environments.

RSM's wireless security testing is performed to identify flaws in wireless implementations so you can better protect your organization from emerging threats. By utilizing some of the same techniques hackers use, our wireless assessment provides a realistic picture of your susceptibility to wireless attacks. It also helps you determine whether data, systems and other wireless users are being properly protected.This testing determines if wireless technologies present an unacceptable level of risk, including their configuration, hardening, usage and security of endpoints (e.g., laptops and mobile devices).

Title: Compliance - Global Compliance and Reporting
Description:
Globally active companies face significant and growing compliance challenges. RSM's global compliance and reporting services help clients manage their global compliance and reporting needs through one global engagement leader, with support from a dedicated U.S.-based team and a robust global network of more than 43,000 professionals. GCRS SERVICE FEATURES: Centralized approach to global compliance, Dedicated single point of contact, Visibility to the status of filings around the world, Standardization of processes,
Local knowledge and understanding of technical and local compliance requirements

NodeName: Compliance - Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Regulatory Compliance
Title: Compliance - Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Regulatory Compliance
Description: RSM's anti-money laundering (AML) and regulatory compliance consulting practice includes former regulators and industry executives who understand both the changing regulatory climate and the challenges and goals at all levels of your business. Our experience makes us uniquely qualified to assess your compliance needs holistically and helps you put in place the people, processes and protections you need to move forward with confidence.RSM's AML and regulatory compliance consultants are recognized industry leaders and will partner with you to protect your organization and ensure ongoing compliance as you grow your business.
EmailSubject: Compliance - Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Regulatory Compliance
