Description:
Advice, Design and Implementation - RSM experts can help you create, test and implement pro-active measures that enhance efficiency and simplify regulatory compliance. For example, when people change jobs or tasks, identity management tools and processes help ensure IT system and data access controls are updated accordingly. Make your operations more resilient by coordinating people, process and tools.

Turn to RSM for:
Access and Identity Mapping 
How is your critical organizational data being used? Who can view, delete or save sensitive files? By building rules and workflows, you can more easily manage employee profiles or temporary rights in active directories, cloud applications or group roles. Assign, track and report on data access and file transfers to improve knowledge about your organization.

Data Protection 
Analyze storage, back-up, replication and restoration with up-to-date safety standards that maximize your IT budget while streamlining workloads. Companies turn to RSM for ongoing support, and even turnkey management, for ever-growing data storage and security complexity.

Security That Fits Your Needs 
Experienced consultants know your industry and help craft the appropriate solution for specific state and federal requirements, meeting compliance goals while ensuring network protection. Count on RSM's hundreds of consultants to not only keep you aware of the newest threats and responses, but to also keep your systems up to date with the latest patches, the most current version releases, and implementation of new best practice solutions and processes.

Title: Regulatory and compliance
Description:
SOC Assurance and Compliance
As a service organisation, you need to accurately communicate the integrity of your financial internal controls, data security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality and privacy to customers and/or their auditors. An appropriate service organisation control report should help establish the trust and confidence that's so crucial in today's highly competitive marketplace.

There are now a variety of reporting options, so making the most appropriate choice for your organisation can be challenging. Which report best conveys what you need your users to know? Is the best fit a SOC Type 1 report or would aSOC 2 or SOC 3 report be better? [INCLUDING SOX, SSAE16 / ISAE 3402 COMPLIANCE AUDITS] Service organisation control reporting
A successful service organisation control (SOC) report helps build trust and confidence by demonstrating that your organisation has the necessary controls implemented and operating effectively, regardless of your organisation's size or industry.

Making the right choice with reporting options is not always easy. We're well-positioned to prepare and issue SOC 1, 2 or 3 assurance reports and discuss customised alternative reporting options under e.g. AICPA attestation standards. Our years of specialisation and experience in SOC reporting will help you arrive at the option best suited to your specific situation.

Our proprietary methodology and SOC-specific software allow us to handle your SOC engagement efficiently.

Title: IT Maturity assessment
Description: RSM's IT Maturity Assessment rates the health of your technology operations, strategy, security and staffing. Gain a holistic view of the maturity of your IT environment, and see how you rank within your industry.

Title: R&D Tax Credits
Description: Find out if you have been gettnig the tax credits for your R&D acitivities. The federal government recognizes that innovation has always been a driving force in the American economy. Through the Research and Development (R&D) Tax Credit (which has expired and been extended 15 times to date) companies can realize a net benefit based on a percent of qualified annual research expenditures that exceed a base amount. In addition to the federal credit, many states offer local R&D tax credits, with parameters that closely mirror the federal program. Despite these opportunities, many companies fail to realize the full benefit of R&D credits because they either don't understand the full range of activities and expenses that qualify or don't develop adequate supporting documentation to sustain the credits under IRS or state examinations.

Title: Operations Strategy assessment
Description: Supply Chain and Channel distribution strategy, SKU Rationalization, Operating model definition and transformation

Title: Client Experience
Description: assessment of channel strategy execution,  customer profitability, pricing strategy, voice of the customer and customer journey mapping.

Title: Performance Improvement
Description: Business turnaround, Cost management and cost take out, working capital improvement, service level transformation, quality improvement

Title: Industry 4.0
Description: Readiness assessment for Industry 4.0, followed by recommendations and strategy to prepare you for the upcoming shifts in the industry

Title: M&A Support
Description:
Every deal presents unique opportunities, risks and challenges. As a potential buyer, it's critically important that your team performs enough buy-side due diligence to ensure the acquisition delivers the right fit for the right price. As a potential seller, performing due diligence reduces the risk of having surprises surface during the sales process; sell-side due diligence can result in increased surety of close and value retention.

As either a buyer or seller, you can rely on our experienced transaction advisory professionals to thoroughly review financial, operational and strategic assumptions in any potential deal, helping you gain a clear perspective on the opportunities-or dangers-the transaction may present. In addition, RSM's value creation mindset helps deliver value throughout all stages of the transaction life cycle. Operational due diligence, synergy and cost savings, support for integration or carve out planning, integration execution and value capture.

Title: Value -added Tax
Description:
Managing value-added tax obligations, process and structuring
Internationally active middle market businesses are required to deal with a variety of global indirect tax obligations. With many countries changing their value-added tax regulations, it can be a challenge to keep up with the complex task of managing activities in multiple jurisdictions, especially without a technical specialist on staff. With limited in-house resources, reliance is often placed on accounting systems with minimal VAT logic built-in, which can expose organizations to unnecessary risk.

Getting a global VAT position on solid ground
To ensure control of their global VAT compliance, company leadership must have visibility and control of all key global transactions. Accounting systems must be configured to accurately automate VAT decisions, and employees with the technical skills and knowledge must provide effective VAT oversight and assurance.

Title: Security Architecture Review
Description:
During an Architecture Security Review, RSM assesses client's infrastructure design from a security controls perspective. This involves a review of a control set derived from the Center for Internet Security (CIS) Top 20 Critical Security Controls. RSM groups the assessed controls into the five NIST Cyber Security Framework (CSF) domains:
 Identify - Controls that enable the identification of newly added assets.
 Protect - Controls that focus on edge protection as well as protection of data and assets.
 Detect - Review of log collection, event correlation, and current alerting capabilities. 
 Respond - Once an incident is detected, how quickly is the organization able to coordinate its response, how effective is the response, what's the follow through after response has been initiated. 
 Recover - The ability of the organization to recover from a confirmed incident. 
The CIS Critical Security Controls address the fundamental actions that enterprises should take to mitigate cyber risks. They focus on the ability to prevent, alert, and respond to attacks that occur in the real world. The controls have been developed by an international community of information security experts, leveraging actual attack information and effective defenses against actual cyber-attacks. The controls have been tailored to provide the most actionable measures available to detect, prevent, respond, and mitigate damage from both common and most advanced attacks.
By conducting an Architecture Security Review, client will have holistic view of how effective their current policy and programs are, what gaps are currently present, and what level of risk is currently assumed by the organization. The Architecture Security Review is a strategic initiative designed to identify gaps within current security programs and develops the roadmap to elevating the current security posture.

Title: Azure Environment Hardening
Description: RSM can help you define, implement and manage your Azure Environment Hardening program to effectively protect your Azure IaaS and mitigate risk to your business. Azure IaaS requires a proper hardening strategy and approach to ensure effective utilization of Azure security services such as Security Center, Azure Active Directory, Key Vault and others, so that these services are effectively protecting your Azure environment. Virtual Machine clusters, container clusters (e.g. Kubernetes) require well defined hardening standard and configuration management to effectively minimize configuration drift and proactively monitor compliance. Hardening your virtual clusters is really the starting point to securing your Azure Environment. RSM helps you effectively implement Azure security tools such as Azure AD to manage access and user privileges, Key Vault to protect secrets and Security Center to administer and oversee your Azure security to provide your business with a robust, orchestrated approach to Azure security.

Title: Firewall Evaluation
Description:
We will review Client's firewall device configuration. We consider industry best practices and hardening techniques and interpret the rule sets by understanding the overall architecture of Client. By looking at services exposed, ingress and egress points, additional security methods and best practices, we can identify exposures in some of the first lines of defense for a network.
Services include:
 Review firewall rule set of 16 perimeter firewalls. 
 The configuration review will identify deltas with current configuration and client's minimum security baselines. 
 Verify that network segmentation meets security best practices and supports the client's business needs. 
 Review current network environment to ensure planned placement of security devices provides the client's required functionality. 
 Determine traffic flow and ensure proper visibility of communication content within these environments.

Title: Privileged Account Management Review
Description:
Evaluate the clients Identity and Access Management Processes within the client environment
 Review Administrative account provisioning process
 Establish administrative access baseline 
 Review administrative account logging capability
 Review remote support software and tools 
Align entire assessment to NIST CSF Maturity tier.  
Identify improvements and integrate with a IDAM lifecycle specific to client but based on industry best practice.

Title: Vendor Risk Assessment
Description:
RSM's vendor risk management program is designed to offload the burden and considerable overhead involved in managing vendor risk. To do this, our offering blends together four main components:
 * Defining your vendor risk criteria
 * A web-based vendor management portal
 * A dedicated project management team
 * A security assessment
 There are many software offerings on the market today that are designed to capture information used within vendor management programs and provide generic questions. However, software is only one piece of the solution. Significant effort is still required from your team to manage questionnaire responses, remediation activities and analyses. In most cases, an expensive IT security resource is forced to perform both the security analysis and project management components, wasting valuable time that could be spent on more pertinent projects. RSM solves this problem by engaging project management experts and security analysts, each performing the task for which they have been trained.
Based on number of vendors, complexity. A 1 hour scoping call would be required to scope these.

Title: Cyber Governance Review
Description: As organizations continue to evolve to meet the needs of their customers, so too have regulations, security requirements and business requirements in order to protect their customers' data. This evolution increases the need for organizations to develop a consistent, repeatable and measurable program that seeks to protect data based on the risk that it presents to the organization in all locations where it is stored, processed, transmitted or accessed and the systems which are critical to the organization. RSM US LLP (RSM) has developed an approach that will allow the client to develop and deploy a program to identify, classify and protect data using a single, risk-based controls framework across the enterprise and third parties. This will create a single framework that allows for easier articulation of the security program to executives at the client.                To identify scope we would need to perform a scoping session to identify the number of business processes in scope, 2-4 hours.

Title: Data Loss Prevention Assessment
Description:
One day DLP Workshop - interactive sessions that consist of education of Microsoft DLP concepts and solution offerings through discussion of use cases, scenarios and product demonstrations from the RSM demo environment
 Department Data Sensitivity Meetings - RSM will lead meetings with Client department information owners to both educate them on upcoming capabilities of the DLP implementation and document the sensitive data identified by the groups.
 DLP Planning, Service Enablement and Documentation - We will work with client IT resources to provision and set up perquisite services and setting to facilitate the DLP solution.
To identify scope we would need to perform a scoping session to identify the number of business processes in scope, 2-4 hours.

Title: End Point Protection Assessment
Description:
An end-point attack and penetration test simulates an attacker attempting to circumvent the current end-point solution and tests the overall effectiveness of the application. RSM takes a unique approach by using custom-created malicious software ranging from a variety of different experience levels to determine whether a nonsophisticated attacker or a highly sophisticated attacker would be required to bypass the end-point solution. RSM will test the end-point solution and the current configurations. RSM will offer assistance if a different solution is needed, or if configuration changes within the overall hardening of the system and/or software solution are necessary.

To identify scope we would need total number of internal and external IP's to test and a scoping call to validate.

Title: Physical Program Assessment
Description:
Physical site assessment
This assessment is a holistic look into the overall physical security of buildings, facilities and locations. We will evaluate all of the physical security controls in place at in-scope locations. For example, our staff will evaluate access control systems, security guards, closed-circuit television (CCTV) cameras, access badges, locks, security lighting, fences, etc. The physical security assessment is a noninvasive walk-through that is guided by Wabash's security personnel while on-site. 
Physical threat assessment
A physical threat assessment allows a business to identify what physical threats there are to facilities within a geographic area. Threats to physical locations are classified as natural, technological and human caused. The combination of threat data and business processes mapping establishes threat levels for each of the scoped locations. We will categorize the facilities, analyze the threats to determine Wabash's threat level, and make recommendations on specific controls that should be put into place at each site.
A one hour scoping call is necessary to determine the number of locations, types, and needs of the client.

Title: Security Monitoring Assessment
Description:
The logging and monitoring assessment is designed to assist organizations in developing and tailoring an effective logging and monitoring framework for your remote workforce. Reliable logging ensures that events are recorded accurately, which can assist with forensic investigations and troubleshooting. Efficient monitoring helps organizations quickly detect and identify suspicious activity so that the proper response actions can be taken. Together, this provides the foundation for effective response and threat mitigation. It also greatly facilitates a strong defensive posture that enables the organization to meet security expectations and compliance requirements. 
We will interview your network staff and review provided documentation to determine your current logging processes. This includes reviews of on-premises, cloud, and remote architecture, appliances, operating systems, and applications. The logging and alerting assessment serves the following purposes:
 This assessment will provide an independent verification that ensures the current infrastructure and applications meet the organization's security expectations and compliance requirements. 
 This assessment will reduce the risk of data loss or network compromise by identifying and resolving vulnerabilities and weaknesses. 
We will focus on logging related to a primarily remote workforce, which will include endpoint logging strategy, correlation and alerts based on your staffing levels.
Collecting and storing logs is only one part of a log management program. Logs are useful only if they are being reviewed and acted upon. Therefore, our review covers detection mechanisms as just one element in a holistic logging program. Other areas covered include: 
Asset management Assets are known and security baselines have been established.
Detection mechanisms Controls enable the quick identification of newly added assets, as well as systems stepping outside an established baseline.
Resources Personnel are on hand to monitor detection mechanisms.

We will also review detection and response capabilities by using the MITRE ATT&CK Framework to develop and test high-risk attack scenarios.

Title: Cybersecurity Risk Assessment
Description:
During a cybersecurity risk assessment, we will provide a quantitative assessment of information security risks in a form that can be used by executives for efficient decision-making. In addition, the results can be used to begin aligning security efforts with those within enterprise risk management. We will use the National Insititue of Standards and Technology (NIST) Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) to conduct this assessment, which consists of standards, guidelines, and best practices to manage cybersecurity-related risks, threats and vulnerabilities present in the environment. This framework provides a prioritized and flexible approach to promote the protection of the organization's systems, infrastructure and operations. The assessment will measure COMPANYNAME's environment based on the ability to identify, protect, detect, respond to and recover from a cyber event, which are the key functions of the NIST CSF. 

To identify scope we would need a 1 hour scoping session to ID company size, complexity, and program maturity.

Title: Organizational Threat Modeling
Description:
To ensure a holistic cybersecurity approach, we also conduct a cyber threat intelligence (CTI) review to identify leaked client data on open and closed (deep and dark web) sources. 
"Deep web" and "dark web" refer to areas of the internet that are not accessible through conventional search engines and are most well-known for hosting underground cyber markets. Illegal activity within these venues includes the sale of personal information, solicitation for stolen corporate data, such as intellectual property and user credentials, and illicit financial services allowing attackers to capitalize on their efforts. Nation states, cyber criminal gangs and malicious individuals thrive in these difficult-to-monitor areas of the web.
A CTI review allows organizations to understand cyberattacks from an adversarial perspective as they scour the underground markets and communication channels in order to identify an attack before it occurs. Often, they are the only method that organizations have to identify that an attack has been successful and is actively removing data. The purpose of a CTI review is to provide predictive, analytical, information-based services pulling from open and closed sources in order to evaluate pending threats or discover attacks that have occurred, but were not detected at the time.

Title: Security Whiteboard Session
Description:
We will conduct a one-day whiteboard session to discuss the status of ongoing remediation activities, roles and responsibilities, and priorities. The outcome of this whiteboard session will be a detailed project plan, along with responsibilities for each party necessary to complete the compliance efforts. This project plan will become the foundation for Constellation's efforts related to PCI compliance.
 day session 
Project plan development to remediate gaps identified during the gap assessment that was completed previously

Title: HIPAA Rapid Assessment
Description:
The HIPAA rapid assessment takes an enterprise-wide approach focusing on client's business environment applicable to electronic protected health information (ePHI) and will cover the HIPAA implementation specifications and compliance practices at the cllient. We will document compliance gaps between client's current state security posture and its expected or target state of security to comply with the HIPAA implementation specifications. We have developed the following tailored approach based on our cybersecurity methodologies:
 We will work closely with security stakeholders at the client including IT management, security operations, IT operations, human resources, compliance and facility security.
 We will assess HIPAA compliance through discussions with process owners and an inspection of documentation to evaluate that stated controls are in place and the control is designed effectively to attain its planned outcome. 

To identify scope we would need a 1 hour scoping session to ID company size, complexity, and program maturity.

Title: HIPAA Risk Analysis
Description: RSM will perform a security risk analysis for COMPANYNAME to fulfill the requirement for Meaningful Use Stage 3, attesting to CMS Security Risk Analysis for the protection of patient health information. As part of the risk analysis, RSM will assess the controls for the following ten specific applications: Meditech (EHR and other clinical systems), PACS (Medical Imaging studies), Dolbey (Dictation/Transcription), Cloverleaf (integration), Muse (EKG), Provation (Endoscopy), iHeal (Wound Care), Allscripts (Physician Offices EHR), Profusion (EEG and Sleep Lab), Fast Track (DME), Eclipse/Aria (Radiation Oncology) and Micros (Food and Nutrician). COMPANYNAME also has hospital-wide policies and departmental policies, covering different areas that we will review as part of this exercise.

Title: HIPAA Remediation Assistance
Description: RSM can provide technical and procedural remediation activities to help our clients achieve and maintain HIPAA Compliance.

Title: HITRUST CSF Readiness Assessment
Description: The assessment procedures are based on the currently HITRUST CSF rules as updated by HITRUST and are designed to focus on a review of policies, procedures and practices, certain specified applications, the IT environment and existing compliance efforts performed by the client. RSM will document the testing of the requirements within the HITRUST CSF tool, identifying weaknesses and corrective actions plans, to then submit to HITRUST for validation.

Title: PCI Readiness Assessment
Description:
RSM will conduct a Payment Card Industry (PCI) scope review and gap assessment to identify areas of non-compliance within client's PCI compliance program and determine, based upon an onsite whiteboard session, how to reduce the scope for PCI Compliance. The PCI Data Security Standards (DSS) provides a detailed, 12-part framework for securing cardholder data (CHD) that is stored, processed and/or transmitted by merchants and service providers. 

To identify scope we would need a 1 hour scoping session to ID company size, complexity, and program maturity.

Title: Web Application Penetration Test
Description:
Evaluates the business logic and flow of the application. 
 Engagement will include brute force login attempts against exposed network devices 
 No denial of service attack testing methodology will utilized 
 Review application for vulnerabilities against the OWASP Top 10 
 All testing will include credentialed and non-credentialed testing 
 RSM testers will not rely on source code 
 Testing will include both webpages as well as APIs
 Both manual and automated tools will be utilized during testing 
 Testing infrastructure technologies including RHEL 7 x, Windows Server 2018R2, F5 Load Balancers, Palo Alto Firewalls 
 Testing database technologies including MySQL 5.7, IBM DB2 11.1, Hadoop, PostgreSQL
 Each engagement will start with a kick off call that includes all key players from RSM and the client to review and understand scope as well as expectations:
o RSM will create a secure portal for communication o Expectations include a depth limit to prevent access to non-scope systems
o Client will be provided a list of testers and contact information before the start of each engagement for better communication during each engagement 
o Escalation lists and procedures will be provided by both Client and RSM in the event critical vulnerabilities are discovered 
 The web application penetration testing will be completed within 60 days of kick off 
 Each web application penetration testing engagement will include one retest within 45 days of completion of initial testing
 At the completion of the full engagement RSM will conduct a board meeting review to discuss all findings
 Off hours testing will included in this engagement

Title: Web Application Vulnerability Scan
Description:
The web application vulnerability scan is designed to treat the application as an "unknown entity" with no knowledge of the tiers provided. RSM will attempt to bypass security restrictions from a no-knowledge hacker perspective. RSM will initiate an attack against the application and attempt to circumvent and bypass specific security restrictions on the site. These attacks typically rely on automated scans, though many attacks are still manual. For the automated portion, RSM utilizes multiple open source and commercial web application security vulnerability scanners such as Burp Suite's active scan. 

To Identify Scope we would need to know the number of functional pages, coding language, and completion of a 30 minute scoping call to determine level of effort.

Title: Wireless Penetration Test
Description:
RSM has developed an approach that is effective in testing the security controls surrounding wireless networked systems. Our wireless penetration testing services include controlled tests in which we will attempt to gain access to [Client Legal Name]'s internal network through your wireless access points. Our methodology contains step-by-step procedures aimed at exploiting weaknesses we have identified. Our methodology is designed to provide a threat-representative assessment, while reflecting industry standards, such as those provided by the Penetration Testing Execution Standard (PTES), as well as those taught by the SANS institute. 

To identify Scope we would need a 30 min call to determine current architecture.
